Replace.Text: The Arrow of Breaking the Army

For each characteristic area in the destination city, the domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value; the international [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route +1 [ICON_Science] technology value [NEWLINE] other civilizations go to the [ICON_TradeRoute] trade of Hurricane Knight The route is +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value; the Hurricane Knight +1 [ICON_Science] technology value. [NEWLINE] After creating [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route, create [ICON_TradingPost] trade post in the destination city; your [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route passes through domestic [ICON_TradingPost] trade post +1 [ICON_Science] technology value; foreign [ICON_TradingPost] trade post +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value. [NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route for each Civic Plaza area and building; +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route for 1 other civilization encountered. [NEWLINE]Cities built gain additional territory.

For each characteristic area in the destination city, the domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route +1 [ICON_Science] technology value; the international [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value [NEWLINE] other civilizations go to Hurricane Knight's [ICON_TradeRoute] trade The route is +1 [ICON_Science] technology value; the Hurricane Knight +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value. [NEWLINE]All the cities you create or capture have [ICON_TradingPost] trading posts from the beginning; your [ICON_TradeRoute] trade routes pass through domestic [ICON_TradingPost] trading posts +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value; foreign [ICON_TradingPost] trading posts +1 [ICON_Science] science value. [NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route for each Civic Plaza area and building; +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route for 1 other civilization encountered. [NEWLINE] When a merchant moves within 3 tiles of a city for the first time, unowned tiles will fall under empire control.

For each characteristic area in the destination city, the [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value, +1 [ICON_Science] technology value [NEWLINE] The [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route of other civilizations to the Hurricane Knight is +1 [ICON_Culture ] culture value, +1 [ICON_Science] technology value; +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value, +1 [ICON_Science] technology value for Hurricane Knight. [NEWLINE]Create a [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route and immediately create a [ICON_TradingPost] trade post in the destination city; all cities you create or conquer will have a [ICON_TradingPost] trade post from the beginning; your [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route passes through [ICON_TradingPost] Trade station +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value, +1 [ICON_Science] technology value. [NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route for each Civic Plaza area and building; +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route for 1 other civilization encountered. [NEWLINE]Cities built gain additional territory. When a merchant moves within 3 tiles of a city for the first time, the unowned tile falls under imperial control.
The wind waits for eight dances

All units ignore movement penalties caused by terrain and rivers. Immune to hurricane type hazards. Cells around cities and districts automatically generate roads. [NEWLINE]Regions provide [ICON_Culture] culture equal to [ICON_Production] production. [NEWLINE]All units have +1 [ICON_Movement] movement power, and gradually increase [ICON_Strength] combat power with the evolution of the times when attacking. [NEWLINE]If you are the first civ to get aviation units, all aviation units get an [ICON_Promotion] boost.

All units ignore movement penalties caused by terrain and rivers. Immune to hurricane type hazards. Cells around cities and districts automatically generate roads. [NEWLINE]Regions provide [ICON_Science] technology equal to [ICON_Production] production. [NEWLINE]All units have +1 [ICON_Movement] movement power, and gradually increase [ICON_Strength] combat power with the evolution of the times when defending. [NEWLINE]If you are the first civ to get aviation units, all aviation units get an [ICON_Promotion] boost.

Except for the "Shenwei Lingzhuang Eight Fans", the capital +80% [ICON_Gold] gold coins. +4 [ICON_Gold] gold coins for all trade routes; +4 [ICON_Gold] gold coins for alliance trade routes. [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points obtained +50%.

In addition to "Shenwei Lingzhuang·Baban", the game is located in the ocean cell at the beginning, land units can board ships and have the ability to enter the ocean cell, and pioneers can build cities in the sea area. +2 [ICON_Science] technology value and +2 [ICON_Culture] culture value every round before opening up the first city. Not subject to flood damage.

In addition to "Shenwei Lingzhuang·Bafan", civilian units +1 [ICON_Movement] mobility, no boarding movement penalty, and can enter the territory of other countries. Obtain an observation balloon when creating a city on a continent other than the [ICON_Capital] capital.

All units ignore movement penalties caused by terrain and rivers. Immune to hurricane-type disasters, and the enemy suffers double damage from hurricane-type disasters. Cells around cities and regions automatically generate roads, and domestic roads are upgraded by one level. . [NEWLINE]Regions provide [ICON_Culture] culture and [ICON_Science] technology equal to [ICON_Production] production. [NEWLINE]All units +1 [ICON_Movement] movement power, and gradually increase [ICON_Strength] combat power with the evolution of the times, if there is unused movement power, the combat power will be improved; all enemy units -1 [ICON_Movement] movement power, if there is unused movement power The movement power used reduces the combat power. [NEWLINE]If you are the first civ to get aviation units, all aviation units get an [ICON_Promotion] boost.

Will attempt to maximize [ICON_Gold] gold output from its cities and [ICON_TradeRoute] trade routes. Respects civilizations that do things like it, dislikes civilizations that don't. [NEWLINE]Admiring civilizations that explore the world, and dislikes people who huddle within their own boundaries. [NEWLINE]Try to build an air force. Envious of civilizations with powerful air forces. Hate civilizations with weak air forces.

Eight Dance Sisters characteristic area. Allows you to build and store aircraft in the area. It replaces the airport area and is not subject to population restrictions, and the cost is lower. Cannot be built on hills. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum per turn. +10% [ICON_Production] production in the city where you live. [NEWLINE] Air units have +2 [ICON_Strength] combat strength.

Based on the project area, a small amount of [ICON_Science] technology value is provided every round, and [ICON_GreatGeneral] general points are provided after completion. [NEWLINE]When carrying out the project, all aircraft stationed in the city's airport area get +2 experience points every round; after completion, all aircraft stationed in the city's airport area get +4 experience points.
Eight dance sisters characteristic support unit. Replaces military engineers. [NEWLINE]Automatically pave roads as you move.
Can climb cliffs. No disembarkation costs.

Can only be built by Military Engineers. Does not cost uses, but costs 1 point of [ICON_IRON] iron and 1 point of [ICON_ALUMINUM] aluminum to build. The [ICON_Movement] movement speed of any unit moving from one railway tile to another will be greatly increased. The [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route that overlaps with the high-speed rail can get multiplied gold coins from its destination area.

Yamai Yaguya unique naval transport unit. Instead of an aircraft carrier, it transports air units. [NEWLINE]Cannot attack, but can intercept air strikes. With a unique reinforcement tree, research and development of information age technology can directly unlock upgrade items.

Yamai Yuzuru features a naval transport unit. Instead of an aircraft carrier, it transports air units. [NEWLINE]Cannot attack, but can intercept air strikes. With a unique reinforcement tree, research and development of information age technology can directly unlock upgrade items.

Fengdaibawu unique naval transport unit. Instead of an aircraft carrier, it transports air units. [NEWLINE]Cannot attack, but can intercept air strikes. With a unique reinforcement tree, research and development of information age technology can directly unlock upgrade items.
Gain recovery each turn. [NEWLINE]Health regenerates outside friendly territory.
+10 bonus healing for self and adjacent naval units.
+1 [ICON_Movement] movement. [NEWLINE]+1 extra aircraft slot. [NEWLINE]+5 air units that are stationed in the treatment of boils.
Yamai Sisters feature a modern aerial combat unit that replaces biplanes. [NEWLINE]Flying range is wider; experience gained +50%.
Yamai Sisters features a modern air bombing unit that can be upgraded to a bomber. [NEWLINE]+50% XP gained.
The Yamai Sisters feature an air combat unit in the atomic age, replacing fighter jets. [NEWLINE]Flying range is wider; experience gained +50%.
The Yamai Sisters feature an atomic age aerial bombardment unit that replaces bombers. [NEWLINE]Flying range is wider; experience gained +50%.
Yamai sisters characteristic information age air combat unit, replacing jet fighters. [NEWLINE]Flying range is wider; experience gained +50%. It cannot be seen unless it is adjacent to it.
The Yamai Sisters feature an information age air bombing unit that replaces jet bombers. [NEWLINE]Flying range is wider; experience gained +50%. It cannot be seen unless it is adjacent to it.
Yamai Sisters features future-era air combat units, upgraded from stealth fighters. [NEWLINE]Flying range is wider; experience gained +50%. It cannot be seen unless it is adjacent to it.
Yamai Sisters feature future era air bombing unit, upgraded from stealth bomber. [NEWLINE]Flying range is wider; experience gained +50%. It cannot be seen unless it is adjacent to it.

Bunny Girl Hachimai unique medieval heavy cavalry unit that replaces the knight. [NEWLINE]Merchant units within 4 land tiles of Mander Cavalry will not be pillaged. [ICON_Gold] gold coins equal to the basic [ICON_Strength] combat power of the unit can be obtained when the battle is won.
Bikini Octopus An ancient era melee unit that replaces the Warrior. [NEWLINE]Chance to capture and convert enemy military units into friendly builders.

Celebration Eight Dances feature Renaissance heavy cavalry unit that replaces cuirassiers. [NEWLINE] If the damage points are higher than the opponent's, the defending enemy unit will be pushed to the rear cell. If the defending unit cannot retreat, it will suffer additional damage.

The characteristic building of the bunny girl eight dances. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] +1 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction and +2 [ICON_Gold] gold, +1 [ICON_Culture] culture, +1 [ICON_Food] food and +1 [ICON_Production] production. In a city with an [ICON_Governor] executive, there is an extra +1 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction and +2 [ICON_Gold] gold coins. If it is adjacent to the city center, entertainment center and water park, each will have +1 [ICON_Culture] cultural value. As you progress through the technology and civic trees, you can gain additional [ICON_Culture] culture, [ICON_Tourism] tourism, and [ICON_Housing] housing. Only one golf course can be built per city and cannot be adjacent to other golf courses. A tile with a golf course cannot be exchanged. +2 [ICON_Appeal] Charisma.

Eight dance sisters characteristic building. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1[ICON_Gold] gold coin, [ICON_Production] productivity, [ICON_Science] technology value. Each round provides 1 point of [ICON_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM]{LOC_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM_NAME} and 2 points of [ICON_Power]. [NEWLINE]Must be built on hills.

Eight dance sisters characteristic building. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1[ICON_Gold] gold coin, [ICON_Production] productivity, [ICON_Science] technology value. Each round provides 1 point of [ICON_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM]{LOC_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM_NAME} and 2 points of [ICON_Power]. [NEWLINE]Must be built on a coast or lake feature.

The characteristic building of the celebration eight dances. [NEWLINE]Provide 2 points of [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction, +2 [ICON_Culture] culture value, +2 [ICON_Faith] faith value, and 1 point [ICON_GreatGeneral] general point. Having the "Save" civic grants +1 [ICON_TOURISM] tourism merit.

Eight dance sisters characteristic building. [NEWLINE]Automatically convert any amount of [ICON_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM]{LOC_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM_NAME} into [ICON_Power] electricity and power cities within 6 cells at a rate of:[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]1 point[ICON_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM]{LOC_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM_ NAME}[ ICON_PowerRight] 1 point [ICON_Power] electricity. [NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet] emits no carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. [NEWLINE][ICON_Production] Productivity, [ICON_Science] Technology and [ICON_Culture] Culture bonuses extend to all city centers within 6 tiles that do not receive Power Plant building bonuses.

Celebration Bawu characteristic building. [NEWLINE]+2[ICON_Production] Production. [NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Gold] for each adjacent Hurricane Harvesting Station and Offshore Hurricane Harvesting Station. [NEWLINE]Convert [ICON_Power] from Hurricane Harvesting Stations within 6 cells to [ICON_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM]{LOC_RESOURCE_YAMAI_STORM_NAME}.
+{1_num}[ICON_Production] Production from adjacent Hurricane Collection Stations.
+{1_num}[ICON_Science] Science from adjacent Hurricane Collection Stations.

Decommission the power plant currently used by this city and replace it with {LOC_BUILDING_YAMAI_STORM_DISTRIBUTION_NAME}. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_BUILDING_YAMAI_STORM_DISTRIBUTION_NAME}:[NEWLINE]{LOC_BUILDING_YAMAI_STORM_DISTRIBUTION_DESCRIPTION}
Requires 2 points of [ICON_Power] electricity, and reduces carbon emissions by 5 points per round.
